intro: Chuquiraga horrida, commonly known as the rough chuquiraga, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually small, hairy, and arranged alternately along the stem. Chuquiraga horrida is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in some regions for its potential health benefits.
